info.title: Domain Availability Bulk
info.description: Check availability of 100 domain names at a time! This also returns if the domain is listed in the aftermarket marketplaces. Coming soon: expiration date and price. Also see our "Domain Suggestions TLDs" API "https://rapidapi.com/besta-domains/api/domain-suggestions-tlds". Please read more at https://besta.domains/api.

get.summary: Check 100 domain names at a time! Find which are available, aftermarket, expiring, invalid, etc.

200.description:
Returns data object. Within that object is another object called "domains". It contains key/value pairs. Key is the domain name which you sent. Value is a status code. Codes:
0: not checked, unknown
1-9: not available
10: available to purchase!
100-9,999,999: premium or aftermarket. Code = purchase price.
10,000,000: listed in aftermarket, but asking price is unknown
100,000,000+: not available, not listed, but expiring soon! Code = expiration date, as Unix timestamp.

get.description: Check 100 domain names at a time. Find which are available, aftermarket, expiring, invalid, etc. Availability/aftermarket detection are already work reliably/accurately and very fast. Coming soon: option to check expiration date, validity, and price. Also see our "Domain Suggestions TLDs" API "https://rapidapi.com/besta-domains/api/domain-suggestions-tlds". This API is still in development, but is stable. All future changes will be backward compatible. Please read more and learn about our plans for the future: https://besta.domains/api. See demo app, using this API: https://besta.domains

parameters.name: domains
parameters.description:
If you prefer, instead of a JSON Array, you may send a "comma, separated, string" with no quotes. TLD must be included. Spaces are allowed and will be removed. 

This is useful because this API accepts both GET or POST requests. Your choice. Both are treated as a request for data. Although, we recommend you use POST data and JSON Array.

requestBody.description: POST data uses same keys/values as Query Params. Please refer to Query Params for descriptions. If using POST request, you may choose to send some variables as POST data, and others as Query Params. If both are sent for the same key, Query Params will be preferred. More options coming soon. To learn more, please see https://besta.domains/api.
